Name: Overseer Tamric Bolden
Backstory: An aging veteran of trade guilds, Tamric oversees market disputes, stall placements, and tax collections. Though gruff and balding, he’s well-liked for being fair and secretly keeps a book of coded debts.

Name: Merchant Ysara Veln
Backstory: Ysara runs a spice and dye stall, importing goods from coastal traders. Elegant and sharp-witted, she once belonged to a noble house that fell from grace. She's rumored to be fencing more than saffron.

Name: Merchant Harv Drand
Backstory: A barrel-chested cheese and cured meat seller who prides himself on knowing everyone’s business. Harv used to be a guard before retiring after losing a finger to a dire rat.

Name: Peddler Enna Tirl
Backstory: A wiry, fast-talking woman who sells trinkets, broken charms, and ‘lucky stones.’ Her coins vanish as fast as her wares, and children adore her for her wild tales.

Name: Farmer Dorik Henn
Backstory: Dorik travels in weekly with potatoes, onions, and smoked pork. A blunt, dirt-covered man who rarely speaks unless bartering. He's the last survivor of a plague-blighted hamlet.

Name: Farmer Ilyne Voss
Backstory: Sharp-tongued and no-nonsense, Ilyne sells eggs and root vegetables with uncanny speed. She once punched a noble who short-changed her—and paid dearly for it.

Name: Townsfolk Brinn
Backstory: A young street-runner who carries baskets and messages for tips. Brinn’s mother was a weaver, lost in the fire three years ago. He sleeps in alleyways and worships Ori as a legend.

Name: Townsfolk Sister Dell
Backstory: A former midwife turned gossip-monger, Sister Dell spends her afternoons offering unsolicited advice and reading palms. Many dismiss her, but her predictions often come true.
